channel.title: [PI] Memory Leak... ! [PI]
channel.description:
Well title says it all. please help me fix the memory leaks in the DSPK [PI] Source.
I know there's quite a few and don't tell me to "switch sources" or anything cause I'm using this one.

item.title: [PI] Memory Leak... ! [PI]
item.dc:creator: @extinct2255 extinct2255
item.description:
@extinct2255 wrote:

This is Intdubpk source.

The MemLeak fixed, run.bat is he just changed the xm1012xm to stop one of the memory leaks. < i dont think i spelt the xm system correctly

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Memory Leak... ! [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“sarranoob, post:10, topic:382210”][quote author=Cres link=topic=478013.msg3498633#msg3498633 date=1297550977]

well,

i have a PI (don’t know what PI means tbh =/) and in the source file there is a batch file that is named: Memleak(fixed).bat
ive never run it since i have no clue what it means =/ i can give you the code if you want…

PI stands for Project Insanity , somewhat the original base ( actually it is based off of emulous / riotscape ).
and could i see the code of that batch file?
[/quote]
well, that makes sence lol =D

heres the code:

@echo off
title Memleak (fixed)
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
pause

save as a .bat in youre source folder. (i have not tested it so i have no clue that it will work, you might need to change the jdk (ill geuss you know that =D))[/quote]

strange , it looks like a normal batch file to run the server…

Read full topic

[/quote]

PI stands for Project Insanity , somewhat the original base ( actually it is based off of emulous / riotscape ).
and could i see the code of that batch file?[/quote]
well, that makes sence lol =D

heres the code:

@echo off
title Memleak (fixed)
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
pause

save as a .bat in youre source folder. (i have not tested it so i have no clue that it will work, you might need to change the jdk (ill geuss you know that =D))
